modules.description: This module manages focus states for UI components in a terminal interface. It provides handles to request or release focus, and status values that track whether a component currently has focus. Use it to coordinate interactive elements like text inputs or buttons, ensuring only one component receives keyboard events at a time.

The module provides operations to construct and manipulate terminal-based UI elements, supporting layout composition through resizing, alignment, and hierarchical structuring. It works with UI elements and layout specifications, enabling event handling for keyboard and mouse interactions alongside dynamic dimension monitoring. This facilitates building responsive interfaces like text editors, menu systems, or interactive widgets that adapt to terminal resizing and user input events.

This module creates and manages terminal UI renderers that process input events and generate images. It handles mouse and keyboard events, updates UI content at specific sizes, and retrieves rendered images. Use it to build interactive terminal applications with dynamic layouts and event-driven behavior.

This module defines and manipulates gravity values that determine alignment in terminal user interfaces. It combines horizontal and vertical directions into a single gravity value, supporting operations to construct, deconstruct, and print these values. Concrete use cases include aligning UI elements such as buttons or text blocks to specific corners or edges within a terminal window.

This module offers operations for constructing and managing terminal-based user interfaces with a focus on text rendering, layout composition, and interactive elements. It works with reactive UI values (`Lwd.t`) and structures like scrollable regions, boxes (horizontal/vertical/z-box), grids, buttons, and input fields to enable dynamic updates and layered content. Use cases include building scrollable dashboards, form-driven interfaces with file selectors or toggles, and layered UIs with menus or overlays that respond to user input.

This module provides primitives for building terminal user interfaces with layout composition, alignment, and event handling. It works with UI elements, focus states, and gravity values to manage interactive components like text inputs, buttons, and dynamic layouts. Concrete use cases include creating resizable terminal applications such as text editors, menu systems, and interactive widgets that respond to keyboard and mouse input.
